intro: Moricandia sonchifolia, commonly known as the common moricandia, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lobed leaves and yellow flowers arranged in a composite inflorescence. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its seeds are small and oval, with a pappus that aids in wind dispersal.
